name: San Francisco

authority.name: SFMTA Customer Service Center
authority.serves_description: Most San Francisco parking citations are issued and processed by the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency.

citation_pattern.notes: Standard city parking and transit citations display 'SFMTA' or 'MT' followed by eight digits.

submission_methods.notes: Citations can be protested online via the SFMTA website, by mailing a protest form, or by visiting the Customer Service Center.

phone_confirmation.department: SFMTA Customer Service Center / Citation Review
phone_confirmation.purpose: Confirm the correct mailing address and procedures for SFMTA citation protests.

verification.source_note: Protest mailing address and process confirmed on SFMTA's 'Contest a Citation' page【111240306093384†L114-L121】 and contact phone 311 listed for assistance【111240306093384†L99-L101】.

official_confirmation_purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing for San Francisco parking citations.
qa_blocking_issues: SFPD routing to SFMTA requires confirmation to ensure all police-issued citations follow this process.
SFSU, USF, and CCSF sections lack publicly available mailing addresses for appeals; confirmation by phone is needed.
qa_known_gaps: Citation patterns for campus authorities are inferred and have low confidence.
Several campus authorities rely on online-only appeal processes; mailing addresses may exist but were not published.
